@graph.name: Shopify Collections CSV Importer
@graph.description: Advanced tool for importing Shopify collections via CSV files, enabling bulk collection management and automated product organization for e-commerce stores.
@graph.browserRequirements: Modern web browsers supporting HTML5 and JavaScript

@graph.name: How to Import Shopify Collections via CSV
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide for importing collections into Shopify using CSV files

step.name: Prepare CSV File
step.text: Format your CSV file with required collection fields including name, description, and handle

step.name: Upload CSV
step.text: Select and upload your CSV file using the import tool interface

step.name: Map Fields
step.text: Map CSV columns to corresponding Shopify collection fields

step.name: Preview Import
step.text: Review the import preview to verify data accuracy

step.name: Execute Import
step.text: Run the import process to create collections in your Shopify store

mainEntity.name: What CSV format is required for importing Shopify collections?

acceptedAnswer.text: The CSV should include columns for collection name, handle, description, and any custom fields. Headers must match Shopify's collection field names.

mainEntity.name: Can I import collections with products assigned?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, you can include product assignments in your CSV by referencing product handles or IDs in designated columns.

mainEntity.name: What happens if there are errors in my CSV file?

acceptedAnswer.text: The tool validates your CSV and provides detailed error reports, allowing you to fix issues before importing.

@graph.name: Importing Shopify Collections Via CSV

hasDefinedTerm.name: Collection Handle
hasDefinedTerm.description: Unique identifier for Shopify collections used in URLs and API calls

hasDefinedTerm.name: CSV Mapping
hasDefinedTerm.description: Process of matching CSV column headers to Shopify collection fields

hasDefinedTerm.name: Bulk Import
hasDefinedTerm.description: Method of importing multiple collections simultaneously using batch processing
